<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fu Water](/Equipment.aspx?ID=987)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Good" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=83" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Potion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=130" />
<trait label="Splash" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=150" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 161 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 21 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Burnt fulu ashes float in this liquid, lending a distinctive red color and imparting it with a variety of purifying effects. Unlike many [fulu](/Equipment.aspx?Category=15&Subcategory=61) items, _fu water_ must be created using [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) magic.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> Interact;     **Effect** This potion functions as a bottle of [_holy water_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=245). Like holy water, you throw it as a Strike. It's a simple [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn't add the [manipulate](/Actions.aspx?ID=639) trait to the attack made with it.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> Interact;     **Effect** You drink the _fu water_ to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) ailments within yourself. Attempt a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check with a +9 counteract modifier and a counteract level of 3 against one effect that imposes the [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14), [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19), or [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) condition. You are then [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
